abstracts.cdata!:
The Electricity Transmission and
            Conservation Project Loan for Brazil was approved on June
            14, 1990 by the Executive Directors of the World Bank. On
            April 22, 1992, the Bank, dissatisfied with the
            government's not authorizing sufficient sector-wide
            power tariff increases to comply with the major condition
            for effectiveness, withdrew the loan.
